'''Cornelia Caroline Funke''' (born [[December 10]], [[1958]], in [[Dorsten]], [[North Rhine-Westphalia]]) is a multiple award-winning [[Germans|German]] author of [[children's fiction]]. She is best known for her ''[[Inkworld trilogy]]'', with the English translation of the third, ''[[Inkdeath]]'', to be released in early 2008. SHE ALSO CREATED DREAGON RIDER! The Inkworld books have gained a variety of attention, and critics have praised Funke as the "German [[J. K. Rowling]]".<ref name=time/> Her books are very popular in her native country, and many have now been translated into [[English language|English]]. Her work fits mainly into the [[fantasy]] and [[adventure]] genres. She currently lives in [[Los Angeles, California]].
+
'''Cornelia Caroline Funke''' (born [[December 10]], [[1958]], in [[Dorsten]], [[North Rhine-Westphalia]]) is a multiple award-winning [[Germans|German]] author of [[children's fiction]]. She is best known for her ''[[Inkworld trilogy]]'', with the English translation of the third, ''[[Inkdeath]]'', to be released in early 2008. The Inkworld books have gained a variety of attention, and critics have praised Funke as the "German [[J. K. Rowling]]".<ref name=time/> Her books are very popular in her native country, and many have now been translated into [[English language|English]]. Her work fits mainly into the [[fantasy]] and [[adventure]] genres. She currently lives in [[Los Angeles, California]].
